instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an  <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A where the keyboard doesn't work. I've already replaced 2 other keyboards, trackpad and cables, and the keyboard still doesn't work.

I supose that the problem is on the board, but I don't know where to start.

F4800 = 8.59V
L4800 = 8.59V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_KBD_F</SIGNAL> = 3.293V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_KBD_F</SIGNAL> = 4.9V

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Very strange; keyboard is not connected directly to MLB.
Still not working before entering macOS, into boot menu?
Power button and SMC reset OK?

Just in case, check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi,
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.269V

I even booted with an external disk, and it doesn't work. 

With an external keyboard, the external keyboard works fine...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Your problem is between TP and KB.
Test with known good trackpad.
